ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. Students interested in cognitive science and philosophy would certainly benefit from taking this course.
It is an overview of the structure of the mind--different systems and contested positions.Take it if you have a background in the material. There is no instructor better to introduce the material.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: On one hand, the course covered a great deal of research and while I was familiar with some of it, I found it particularly helpful in thinking through the implications of the research for philosophical theories.On the other hand, the course was also helpful in thinking through some of the philosophical theories that seem to make empirical commitments and working out how to test those.While my dissertation won't be on this exact topic, it is highly relevant and has certainly deepened my understanding of the underlying issues.
We learned how much contention there is on the topic.
